FuncDef:
The if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command configures a matching rule based on a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets.
The undo if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command deletes a matching rule based on a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets.
By default, no matching rule based on a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the function of filling QoS policy IDs in VXLAN headers is enabled, different QoS policy IDs can be configured for VXLAN packets. To classify traffic based on such a QoS policy ID to implement a different traffic policy, run the if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command in the traffic classifier view to configure a matching rule. Then configure a traffic behavior, configure a traffic policy and associate the traffic classifier with the traffic behavior, and apply the traffic policy to the corresponding interface.
Precautions
The traffic classifier configured with the if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command cannot be applied to a global UCL or ACL.
The if-match vxlan-qos-local-id and if-match qos-local-id commands cannot both be configured in a traffic classifier where the relationship between rules is AND.
If the qppb-policy qos-local-id both inbound command has been run on the interface to which a traffic policy is applied, the if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command cannot be run for the interface.
If the if-match vxlan-qos-local-id command is configured for a cascaded traffic policy, the command can be issued but does not take effect.
